sentences.en: As a teenager I was obsessed ragtime , and bluesy guitar guys like Johnny Winter.
sentences.cn: 当我十几岁的时候我迷上了雷鬼, 和JohnnyWinter那样的布鲁斯吉他手.

sentences.en: He has recorded every major work for the violin, and has also recorded jazz, ragtime and Jewish folk music.
sentences.cn: 他录制了每一首主要的小提琴曲，爵士乐，拉格泰姆以及犹太人民间音乐。

sentences.en: His music, which used most of the conventions of ragtime, also included improvisation and elements of the blues, two aspects that were widely influential in the development of jazz.
sentences.cn: 他的音乐中最多的是使用了拉格泰姆的传统，也揉和了即兴演奏和布鲁斯元素，这两种风格在爵士乐发展中起到广泛作用。

sentences.en: It is a ragtime song called Lots O'Fingers.
sentences.cn: 这首拉格泰姆歌叫做《多指》.

sentences.en: Joplin is considered the foremost composer of ragtime music.
sentences.cn: 吉普林被认为是拉格泰姆（Ragtime）音乐最重要的作曲家。

sentences.en: Ragtime also influenced the creation of jazz.
sentences.cn: 拉格泰姆音乐也影响了爵士乐的形成.

sentences.en: Ragtime is a kind of music played by a solo pianist.
sentences.cn: 散拍音乐是一种钢琴独奏的音乐形式.

sentences.en: Ragtime music was popular in the early 20 th century.
sentences.cn: 20世纪初期拉格泰姆音乐很流行.

sentences.en: The most popular music back then was called ragtime .
sentences.cn: 那时最流行的音乐叫拉格泰姆音乐。

sentences.en: The most popular music back then was called ragtime.
sentences.cn: 那时最流行的音乐叫拉格泰姆音乐.

sentences.en: The ragtime had a cracked, heartbroken rhythm as though it were a one - step of despair.
sentences.cn: 爵士乐曲发出破碎 、 伤心的节奏,倒象是绝望的独步舞曲.

sentences.en: There have been different kinds of jazz music, the blues , ragtime, swing boogiewoogie and others.
sentences.cn: 爵士音乐有各种不同的形式, 如勃鲁斯 、 繁音拍子 、 摇摆乐,布吉舞曲等等.

trans.tran_en: a type of music and dancing that has a strong beat and was popular in the US in the early part of the 20th century
